      Performs only the specified mouse event (see DOMMouseEvent) on this element element and waits until the document at the new location (if any), is fully loaded.

      Simulates a real focus event (also generates the blur on the current active element if any).

      • click

        public boolean click(boolean waitUntilLoaded)
        Description copied from interface: DOMElement
        Simulates a real mouse left click on an element. It generates mousemove mousedown and mouseup. Also, proper focus and blur events are generatedexecuteJavaScript
        Specified by:
        click in interface DOMElement
        Parameters:
        waitUntilLoaded - if true, the method is performed synchronously and waits until the document at the new location (if any), is fully loaded.
        Returns:
        in case the method is performed synchronously, it returns true if a new url navigation has been triggered, false otherwise.

      • click

        public DOMWindow click()
        Description copied from interface: DOMElement
        Simulates a real mouse left click on an element. It generates mousemove mousedown and mouseup. Also, proper focus and blur events are generated It waits until the document at the new location (if any), is fully loaded. If the click triggers opening a new window, it is returned as result, otherwise the current winndow is returned
        Specified by:
        click in interface DOMElement
        Returns:
        If a new window has been opened due to the click, the new window is returned, otherwise the current window is returned (which may have a new location).

      • fireMouseEvent

        public DOMWindow fireMouseEvent(String event)
        Description copied from interface: DOMElement
        Performs only the specified mouse event (see DOMMouseEvent) on this element element and waits until the document at the new location (if any), is fully loaded. If the event triggers opening a new window, it is returned as result, otherwise the current window is returned. Note: this method won't generate related events, e.g., for click it won't simulate the correct sequence, but only the click event.
        Specified by:
        fireMouseEvent in interface DOMElement
        Parameters:
        event - (see DOMMouseEvent)
        Returns:
        If a window has been opened due to the event, the new window is returned, otherwise the current window is returned (which may have a new location).

      • fireFocusEvent

        public DOMWindow fireFocusEvent(String event)
        Description copied from interface: DOMElement
        Performs the specified focus/blur event (see DOMFocusEvent) on this element element and waits until the document at the new location (if any), is fully loaded. If the event triggers opening a new window, it is returned as result, otherwise the current window is returned. To simulate the user focus action, use the method focus()
        Specified by:
        fireFocusEvent in interface DOMElement
        Parameters:
        event - (see DOMFocusEvent)
        Returns:
        If a window has been opened due to the event, the new window is returned, otherwise the current window is returned (which may have a new location).

      • fireKeyboardEvent

        public DOMWindow fireKeyboardEvent(String event,
                                   char printableChar)
        Description copied from interface: DOMElement
        Performs the specified focus event (see DOMKeyboardEvent) on this element element and waits until the document at the new location (if any), is fully loaded. If the event triggers opening a new window, it is returned as result, otherwise the current window is returned
        Specified by:
        fireKeyboardEvent in interface DOMElement
        Parameters:
        event - (see DOMKeyboardEvent)
        printableChar - the char related to the key event.
        Returns:
        If a window has been opened due to the event, the new window is returned, otherwise the current window is returned (which may have a new location).

      • type

        public DOMWindow type(String content)
        Description copied from interface: DOMElement
        Enter the given text of characters on the element (usually an input text). This simulates the sequence of acquiring the focus and generating keydown,keypress,keyup for each key of the content. It waits until the document at the new location (if any), is fully loaded. If the event triggers opening a new window, it is returned as result, otherwise the current window is returned
        Specified by:
        type in interface DOMElement
        Parameters:
        content - the text to enter
        Returns:
        If a window has been opened due to the event, the new window is returned, otherwise the current window is returned (which may have a new location).

      • typeAndEnter

        public DOMWindow typeAndEnter(String content)
        Description copied from interface: DOMElement
        As the method type(String content), it types the given text on the element (usually an input text) and then generates the "VK_RETURN" keypress event at the end. It waits until the document at the new location (if any), is fully loaded. If the event triggers opening a new window, it is returned as result, otherwise the current window is returned
        Specified by:
        typeAndEnter in interface DOMElement
        Parameters:
        content - the text to enter
        Returns:
        If a window has been opened due to the event, the new window is returned, otherwise the current window is returned (which may have a new location).

      • mouseover

        public DOMWindow mouseover()
        Description copied from interface: DOMElement
        Simulates a real mouseover event (mousemove and mouseover). It waits until the document at the new location (if any), is fully loaded. If the event triggers opening a new window, it is returned as result, otherwise the current window is returned
        Specified by:
        mouseover in interface DOMElement
        Returns:
        If a window has been opened due to the event, the new window is returned, otherwise the current window is returned (which may have a new location).executeJavaScript

      • focus

        public DOMWindow focus()
        Description copied from interface: DOMElement
        Simulates a real focus event (also generates the blur on the current active element if any). It waits until the document at the new location (if any), is fully loaded. If the event triggers opening a new window, it is returned as result, otherwise the current window is returned
        Specified by:
        focus in interface DOMElement
        Returns:
        If a window has been opened due to the event, the new window is returned, otherwise the current window is returned (which may have a new location).

                           float y)
        Description copied from interface: DOMElement
        Sends a click event on the given coordinates
        Specified by:
        sendClick in interface DOMElement
        Returns:
        If a window has been opened due to theObject executeJavaScript(String script, Object... arg); event, the new window is returned, otherwise the current window is returned (which may have a new location).
